text_section1.text: Fear! Fear was the force that doomed Herbert Poe to failure! It was the grim shadow that stalked him by day and haunted his nights and Herbert remained its trembling prisoner until he brought about...
The End of a Sinister Man
Herbert Poe was called into the office of Len O'Hara, manager of Falcon Steel Products, Inc. That was how it started...

text_section2.text: Herb, after ten years you're still nurse-maiding a drill press! I could use your know-how but I can't use a man who'd be timid with the men working under him!

text_section3.text: I -- I guess you're right, Mr. O'Hara! All my life I've been scared of people.

text_section1.text: You're scared of everything, Herb, even afraid to drive a car! I want to give you a chance, but first you've got to lick this fear!

text_section2.text: I--I'll try, Mr. O'Hara!

text_section1.text: On his lunch hour that day Herb Poe bought a book.

text_section2.text: 'How to conquer fear!' If only I could!

text_section1.text: '... now to test this theory, force yourself to do something you've never done before!'
Len O'Hara said I'm too scared to learn to drive a car! Then that's where I'll start!
Herb obeyed the impulse, went to the bank and withdrew $1500

text_section2.text: Too late to look at cars now! Maybe after work...

text_section1.text: That man! I'm sure he was in the bank before! He saw me take my money out! He's following me!
He all but ran back to the plant, sure that someone was behind him all the way! And later than afternoon...
Hey, boys - pipe the book mousey Poe got hisself!

text_section2.text: 'How to conquer fear'! Let's see that he gets his money's worth!

text_section1.text: When Herb returned to his drill-press his co-workers had their run

text_section2.text: Oh Herb, I forgot to tell you! There was some creepy-lookin' bird here before askin' for you!

text_section3.text: For me? Are you sure, Joe? W-what's his name?

text_section1.text: He wouldn't tell me his name! Brother, I was glad when he left! That guy had mean eyes!

text_section2.text: Say, Herb... did that man in black find you? Gee, what kind of friends you got? I don't scare easy, but that goon... whew!

text_section1.text: That night Herb Poe arrived home a bundle of nerves...

text_section2.text: It's my money he's after! Got to hide it... tomorrow it goes back to the bank!

text_section1.text: Next morning, as the men were arriving for work at the Falcon plant, they were accosted by a very sinister man...

text_section2.text: Herb Poe? I don't know if he's in yet, mister!

text_section3.text: I wonder what he wants with Herb?

text_section4.text: Not in yet? Never mind! I'll catch up with him sooner or later!

text_section1.text: Herb arrived at the plant a half-hour late! He'd been unable to sleep all night for worry about his $1500.00...
This is on the level, Poe! I've never seen a meaner-looking guy, and Nick Lanier says he's packing a gun!
The frightened man struggled to overcome his dread of the sinister man! He read 'How to conquer fear!' every spare moment...

text_section2.text: '... face up to the things you fear most! If you fear another man approach him deliberately!'

text_section3.text: How can I face someone who's after me with a gun?

text_section1.text: That night, Herb Poe went to a movie! He felt safer in crowds! But when he got home about midnight...

text_section2.text: He forced the window open! Left me (gasp) a note! 'I'm going to get you, Poe!'

text_section1.text: G-Get me? But why? I've never done anyone any harm!
So after another sleepless night, Herb went to the police...

text_section2.text: My window was jimmied open and that note was on my bureau! I want protection, Chief Wallis, and I was a gun permit!

text_section3.text: Sounds like a crackpot! Well, I'll have two men at your house tonight! And I'll give you that gun permit, Mr. Poe!

text_section1.text: Herb returned from work that evening and...

text_section2.text: We're Regan and Ellis, Mr. Poe. Here's my I.D. card!

text_section3.text: I'll feel a lot better with you detectives around!

text_section1.text: But in spite of the all-night police guard, the sinister intruder mysteriously entered Herbert Poe's home...
Herb, feeling safe, slept soundly! But he found a note in the morning...

text_section2.text: He even got by those detectives!

text_section3.text: Police or no police I'm going to get you!

text_section1.text: I -- I don't want to die! It's the money he's after! I'll leave it on the bureau tonight!
'How to conquer fear!' I've read half the book, and I'm still scared! At least I think I am! I don't know what I'd do if it came to a show-down!
A show-down came sooner than expected! He left the $1500.00 for the mysterious prowler, and that same night...

text_section2.text: So you think you can buy me off, Poe!

text_section1.text: Goodbye, Mr. Poe!

text_section2.text: CRACK!

text_section1.text: A sudden change came over the sinister man! He took on the form and being of Herb Poe! He was Herb Poe... for he lived only in Herb's mind... a product of Herb's fear!
You missed your chance! Now you Die!

text_section2.text: BLAM!

text_section1.text: Mr. Poe! Are you all right?

text_section2.text: I got him! I'm sure I got him!

text_section1.text: You showed real courage, Mr. Poe! The bullet hole in your bed shows you had a narrow escape! We're going to hunt for the intruder!

text_section2.text: Yes, go on! I'm not afraid anymore!

text_section3.text: This book did it! I'll never be afraid again!

text_section1.text: I wasn't even afraid to shoot a gun! Hold on! There are two empty shell cases! I only fired one shot!
The truth slowly began to dawn on Herb...

text_section2.text: The window was closed... there's a bullet hole through it! ... is it possible? Those notes... I've got to look at them!

text_section1.text: 'Police or no police, I'm going to get you!' Oh no! (Gasp) I was too upset to notice... these notes are in my own handwriting! I was the sinister intruder!
A few weeks later, a new Herb Poe drove to work in his new job as foreman of the Falcon steel plant!

text_section2.text: Good mornin', boss!
